subject: Ethics
title: Right to a Clean Environment
description: A short lesson to help you apply Right to a Clean Environment.

hook.text: In 2022, the UN declared every person on Earth has a right to a clean, healthy environment.

buildup.text: Over 150 countries now recognize environmental rights in their constitutions or national laws.

discovery.text: The right to a clean environment connects human rights to ecological protection‚Äîdamage nature, violate rights.

twist.text: But a right means nothing without enforcement. Millions still drink poisoned water despite legal protections.

climax.text: Courts in Colombia, India, and the Netherlands have forced governments to act on environmental rights.

punchline.text: A right on paper. A fight in practice.

quiz.question: What did the UN declare in 2022 about environmental rights?
options: Environmental protection should be left entirely to corporations
Only wealthy nations have the right to a clean environment
Every person on Earth has a right to a clean, healthy environment
